# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = split(text, " ")
    
    wrapped_lines = []
    for line in lines
        if length(line) > text_width
            push!(wrapped_lines, line[1:text_width] + "\n"))
            push!(wrapped_lines, "")
            line = line[text_width+1:end]
        end
        push!(wrapped_lines, line))
    end
    return join(wrapped_lines, " "))
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a long text that needs to be wrapped. The maximum text width is 10 characters."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

The output will look something like this:

```
This is a long
text that needs to be
wrapped.

The maximum text width is 10 characters.
```
